q:
Write a query to output the list of employee names from EMPLOYEE that do not start with vowels. Your result cannot contain duplicates.

The EMPLOYEE table is described as follows:

FIELD TYPE
ID NUMBER
NAME VARCHAR
DESIGNATION VARCHAR

Options

1.

SELECT DISTINCT(NAME) FROM EMPLOYEE
WHERE LEFT(NAME,1) NOT IN ('A','E','I','O','U');

2.

SELECT NAME FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE
LEFT(NAME,1) NOT IN ('A','E','I','O','U');

3.

SELECT DISTINCT(NAME) FROM EMPLOYEE
WHERE RIGHT(NAME,1) NOT IN ('A','E','I','O','U');

4.

SELECT DISTINCT(NAME) FROM EMPLOYEE
WHERE RIGHT(NAME,1) NOT IN ('A','E','I','O');

You are working on a Django project. Your task is to retrieve information from a model called STUDENT such that the output is sorted in ascending order on the basis of age and it must contain all the students whose last name starts with 'Agar'. Which of the following code will you use to perform this task:

  1. from user.models import STUDENT  
Student.objects.filter(last_name__contains = 'Agar') & 
Student.objects.all().order_by('age')       
  2. from user.models import STUDENT  
Student.objects.copy(last_name__contains = 'Agar') & 
Student.objects.all().order('age')
  3. from models import STUDENT  
Student.objects.query(last_name__contains = 'Agar') & 
Student.objects.all().order_by('age')
  4. from user.models import STUDENT  
Student.objects.filter(last_name__contains = 'Agar') & 
Student.objects.all('age')

You are working on a Django project. Which of the following code will you use to retrieve all the information from a model called STUDENT:

  1. >>> from user.models import STUDENT
>>> queryset = STUDENT.objects.all()  
  2. >>> from models import STUDENT
>>> queryset = STUDENT.objects.all()  
  3. >>> from user.models import STUDENT
>>> queryset = STUDENT.objects()  
  4. >>> from models.users import STUDENT
>>> queryset = STUDENT.objects.all()
